channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for CO
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for CO

item.title: Report X-2023120833
item.description:
Report X-2023120833

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-04T15:11:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-13
  • City: AURORA
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Damage was discovered in the unload. Upon discovery, the unload manager called for an Admin to come down and contain the shipment. DescribePack: 2 of the 4 bottles have loose lids DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The responding Admin contained the damaged hazmat in a hazardous material spill tote and promptly transported the damage to the hazardous materials cage for processing.

item.title: Report X-2023120831
item.description:
Report X-2023120831

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-04T15:11:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-13
  • City: BROOMFIELD
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: This hazmat was discovered leaking at 10:20pm in front of trailer 130 on the load side by a manager during outbound. The manager called QA whom p/u hazmat and placed it in a red tote. The hazmat was then taken to fumigator. DescribePack: The cap on the pail is not properly sealed. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The hazmat was placed in a plastic bag and red tote.

item.title: Report X-2023120632
item.description:
Report X-2023120632

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-04T15:11:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-08
  • City: DENVER
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package arrived at station wet due to internal leakage from loose caps in 2 bottles of Nu-Calgon Alka-Brite Plus Condenser Coil Cleaner. Package was found by QA at the end of the AM sort near the sorter. Package was already in a plastic bag when it was found, QA placed package in another bag & hazmat tote following a code 39 & being brought to damages to process. DescribePack: Due to the leak, outer & inner container is wet & punctured. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a plastic bag then bagged again & placed in a hazmat tote to avoid further damage & contain spill.

item.title: Report X-2023120836

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Damage was discovered in the unload. The unload manager called out for an admin's assistance in containing the shipment. DescribePack: The shipment leaked from the loose lid/closure. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The admin contained the shipment in a damaged hazardous material spill tote and transported it to the hazmat cage for processing.

  • City: AURORA

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The damage was discovered in the unload. The unload manager said that it fell off the rollers onto the ground, and that's when a leak was noticed. An admin was called upon to come contain the shipment. DescribePack: The leak is at the bottom of the drum, but the entire drum is badly dented. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The admin contained the shipment in a hazardous materials spill tote and transported it to the hazmat cage for processing.

item.title: Report X-2023120881
item.description:
Report X-2023120881

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-02T15:11:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-13
  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Leaking package discovered during sortation. Package placed in lined hazmat tote and sent to QA. DescribePack: Plastic jugs in corrugated carton with corrugated divider. Loose cap on one jug allowed leakage which soiled jugs and corroded carton. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package placed in lined hazmat tote and sent to QA.

item.title: Report X-2023120920
item.description:
Report X-2023120920

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-02T15:11:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-14
  • City: DENVER
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was unloaded from the van and taken to the dock where it was being scanned to the TZ trailer when it was noticed that it was wet. The package was placed in a covered hazmat container and taken to a well ventilated area away from people. DescribePack: The cap of the bottle was not secure enough and caused leakage of the liquid. DurationRel: 16 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed in a covered hazmat container and taken to a well ventilated area away from people.

item.title: Report X-2023121007
item.description:
Report X-2023121007

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-30T17:46:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-18
  • City: DENVER
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 12/18/23, the TILX 200118 was found to be leaking from the top housing of the car. Hazmat responders isolated the car in track 44 and found liquid Nitric Acid to be leaking from the liquid line cap. Inspection revealed that the cap was missing a gasket and the valve was partially open. The valve was closed stopping the release and a new gasket installed. HMR cleaned and neutralized spilled acid and containerized ground impacts for proper disposal.
